intro: Eriogonum deflexum var. brachypodum, commonly known as the shortpod buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed areas such as roadsides and sagebrush steppe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are usually pink or purple. This species is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for insects.
